revised_title: Reversible Gelation in Living Protoplasm: A Study of Colloidal Systems
tldr: The author investigates the properties of colloidal systems in living protoplasm and demonstrates reversible gelation, which plays a crucial role in cell activities such as cell division and conjugation. The study uses dark-ground illumination to observe the Brownian movement of particles in protoplasm and the effects of electrical stimulation on this process.
